title: Solutions to beat plastic pollution - UN Environment Programme
body: We at UNEP are asking everyone to get involved in the just transition to a new plastics economy, which will improve livelihoods for millions of workers in informal settings. Governments can deliver a strong deal to end plastic pollution. Businesses can show innovation and commitment to move away from virgin plastics - starting immediately.
readable_content: - UN Website (2023-12-08): The speech delivered by Inger Andersen, Executive Director of UNEP, addresses the issue of plastic pollution and its impact on ecosystems and human health. The speech emphasizes the need for a global deal to end plastic pollution and outlines the economic costs and necessary shifts for change. It also highlights the importance of a full life-cycle approach to plastics and encourages governments, businesses, financial sectors, engineers, and citizens to get involved in the transition to a new plastics economy. The speech concludes with a call to action to turn off the tap on plastic pollution.
